justification: "To quantify participants' dispositional social preferences, we first measured their Social Value Orientation using the six primary item measure (SVO: Murphy et al., 2011)."

The paper states that participants "were randomly assigned to play either the Dictator ... Game" and that their accept/reject decisions were coded as prosocial or selfish, making the Dictator Game the instrument for measuring prosocial behavior.

Similarly, participants "were randomly assigned to play ... [the] Ultimatum Game" where their accept/reject responses were analyzed as prosocial versus selfish, so Ultimatum Game decisions served as the measure of prosociality.

measured_by: mouse-tracking of first information samples in $Self vs. $Other areas-of-interest
justification: "During the experimental task, we measured participants' information search using mouse-tracking… Participants could then move the mouse cursor over one of two spatially defined areas-of-interest (AOIs) … revealing information about outcomes for either themselves ($Self) or their partner ($Other)."
